api_helper#

1. create_response#

api_helper.create_response(message='', status_code=200, mimetype='application/json')#

A helper function to create response objects to send back to the frontend.

Parameters

  • message (str or '') – Optional message to send back to the frontend.

  • status_code (int or 200) – Status code to return to frontend.

  • mimetype ('application/json' or other mime type.) – Optional mimetype that defaults to type JSON.

Returns

Response object to send to send to frontend

Return type

flask.response

2. create_response_from_scannning#

api_helper.create_response_from_scanning(message='', status_code=200, mimetype='application/json')#

A helper function to create response objects to send back to the frontend.

Parameters

  • message (dic or '') – Optional object payload to send back to the frontend.

  • status_code (int or 200) – Status code to return to frontend.

  • mimetype ('application/json' or other mime type.) – Optional mimetype that defaults to type JSON.

Returns

Response object to send to the frontend

Return type

flask.response

3. insert_new_sample#

api_helper.insert_new_sample(qr_code_key, sample_obj)#

Inserts newly retrieved sample (both from CSV and input form) into our data base. Currently it overrites existing data.

Parameters

  • qr_code_key (str) – The unique identifier for each sample entry.

  • sample_obj (dic) – JSON containing sample information with structure of db schema.

Returns

Boolean to indicate whether or not inserting sample already existed. True if not. False if existed.

Return type

bool

4. parse_csv_to_db#

api_helper.parse_csv_to_db(file_path, info)#

This function is called to parse a CSV uploaded and insert each column of the CSV into our DB.

Parameters

  • file_path (list) – absolute path to our csv file.

  • info – [0,0], a list of size 2 with two intergers. info[0] is count of new samples inserted. info[1] is count of existing samples updated.

Returns

Status-Code: 200 if successful, 500 if unsuccessful

Return type

int
